content.description: Start on "Twilight My Robe" moving leftward to the first clip, left of the crack.  Continue up and left to join the adjacent route after its crux.
Easy climbing next to an obvious crack.
content.location: Located about midway on Clearview Crag. Look for the obvious crack.

content.description: Short route that shares an anchor with The Toll. The climbing eases as you go up and finishes on nice jugs.
content.location: This is the first route encountered on the left side of Clearview Crag.

content.description:
This route begins with a fun strenuous lieback with fingers in a small left-facing corner (the crux might be reaching for a hold above when exiting the lieback). It merges with Troll at the third bolt, which comes in from the left.

This route is named "project" in the ~2008 Ford/Yoder guidebook. (Troll (5.10a/b) is somewhat awkward but not memorable.)
content.location: Left-most bolted route on Clearview Crag, look for 2 parallel bolt lines only 3-4 feet apart (they merge after the first couple of bolts)

content.description: Route to the right of Clearly Human

Begin with dihedral stemming and some inventive moves in a crack until jugs are reached near the third bolt.  Catch a rest up and right, then traverse out left onto the face with some balance-intensive moves.  Finish on easier climbing to the anchor.
content.location: Far right end of Clearview Crag, just above a small roof.  First route West of Dew Claw.

climbs.name: It Couldn't be Clearer
climbs.fa: Leland Windham, Eric Ellis, Keith Johnson

content.description: Begin by climbing the slabby start past two bolts to a crack.  Ascend the crack (face holds optional) to the anchors.
content.location: look for the line with only 2 low bolts

climbs.name: Hostinsanguifilachrymostality, An Opus Too Pure for Its Rhyme

content.description: Start on some detached rocks, head up and left a bit, then traverse up and right through jugs to the chains.
content.location: Immediately left of the mixed route It Couldn't be Clearer (5.10a), easily spotted by two bolts below and a crack above.  The route wanders left, then up and right.

climbs.name: Eye Weighted Hear Butt Know Won New Y

content.description: An awkward route where all options are hard to figure out. Take the boulder-y start straight up or step to the right to avoid the spice.
content.protection: 5 bolts and anchor chains. Shared anchor with "Waldstein."
content.location: Located about midway on Clearview Crag. Look for the obvious crack that marks "Twiglight My Robe." The route is bolted line to the left that travels straight up the face.

climbs.name: Don't Bolt Cracks and Don't Crack Bolts

content.description: Awkward bulge leads to a steep crack and the cliff top.  Walk around or use It Couldn't be Clearer's anchor to rappel.

If you start left on the giant block with boulder start which requires cutting feet, it feels like a 5.10a crux, and is on par with other 5.10a boulder starts in the area. However if you start on the right of the block, if feels more like the graded 5.7. Fun crack blocky climbing. You can set up a TR from above.
content.protection: Gear to 4". Rap rings only, no chains.
content.location: Trad route between 5.10c The Toll and 5.10c Eye Weighted Hear Butt Known Won New Y.

content.description: On the Ford/Yoder recommended routes list. Climb a red, west-facing slab past 4 bolts to the anchor.  Bonus points if you pull down on the mono towards the top!
content.location: If approaching from Sunshine, it's just around the corner from the first route (Portrait of a Jigsaw Burger 11a).
